intro: Colea sytsmae, commonly known as the Sytsma's colea, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Colea sytsmae is considered an endangered species.
